item.title: Ticket #27 (You must have a trailing slash on ping URIs or post.php/editpost just stops) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I had the same problem: adding/updating simply does not work, it says that custom fields were updated but they never are.

I applied your patch to a virgin 1.2, but it doesn't help. The only URL to ping out of the box is "​http://rpc.pingomatic.com/" which has a trailing slash.

Nevertheless, functions:weblog_ping() bails out.

item.title: Ticket #98 (Multiple posts with same post-slug) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: But surely you want to be able to post multiple posts with the same slug, so long as they're on different days (and thus get a different permalink under the default settings) why should it matter?

item.title: Ticket #80 (post meta data is not deleted when the post is deleted) updated
item.dc:creator: majelbstoat
item.description:
Should be a simple enough patch... I think $meta = $wpdb->query("DELETE FROM $wpdb->postmeta WHERE post_id = $post_id");

should be inserted after the statements in 'post.php' that delete the post2cat, comments and post entry itself.

item.title: Ticket #98 (Multiple posts with same post-slug) updated
item.dc:creator: majelbstoat
item.description:
Patch submitted for WP Patch Day :D

File attached (as .txt file this time!)

Sorry, I can't provide a diff because I knocked this up in an internet cafe ;D The file itself should be pretty self explanatory though...

I chose option b) - automatically creating a secondary name. I don't think there's any point in bothering the user with this kind of thing. Plus anything they entered would have to be re-sanitised and checked... It's a whole lot quicker to just do it 'magically' :D

Tested and working on my own WP installation, and I've updated it to use $wpdb->posts instead of $tableposts as per the latest CVS, so there should be no problems.

Contact address in the text file if there are any problems / comments.

item.title: Ticket #128 (Need Delete All or Comment Flood protection) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I agree that there ought to be some comment flooding protection. But, as for comment deletion, isn't the Mass Edit mode good enough for this at the moment? You can already check all comments you want to delete and then delete them in one go, can't you?

Unless you are looking for a button that says "Delete All Comments For This Post", which couldn't discriminate good posts from bad...

item.title: Ticket #194 (Allow timestamp permalinks) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: ​http://wordpress.org/pipermail/cvs_wordpress.org/2004-July/000189.html ​http://wordpress.org/pipermail/cvs_wordpress.org/2004-July/000190.html

item.title: Changeset [1491]: Support timestamp permalinks. Make wider use of is_single(). Bug ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Support timestamp permalinks. Make wider use of is_single(). Bug 0000194.

item.title: Ticket #194 (Allow timestamp permalinks) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Owner, Status changed

item.title: Ticket #194 (Allow timestamp permalinks) created
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
Currently, post permalinks must contain %post_id% or %postname%. We should also accept post permalinks which use only a timestamp. Year, month, day, hour, minute, and second must be specified for a post timestamp permalink. Examples:

/archives/%year%/%monthnum%/%day%/%hour%.%minute%.%second%/ /archives/%year%/%monthnum%/%day%/%hour%/%minute%/%second%/

Here's what needs to be done. generate_rewrite_rules() needs to recognize permalink structures containing YYmmddHHMMSS as unique post permalinks. This means generating trackback rewrite rules for such structures.

Further, is_single() needs to recognize YYmmddHHMMSS queries as queries for single posts.

Uses of $single need to be replaced with is_single(). Using is_single() in comments_popup_link() will fix the problem where the comments form is not displayed for timestamp permalinks.

item.title: Ticket #193 (Generic pings that fail stop any subsequent pings) created
item.dc:creator: MCincubus
item.description:
For example, if you have WP set to ping these URIs: ​http://microsoft.com/ ​http://rpc.pingomatic.com/

in that order, Ping-O-Matic won't get the ping, because the ping to ​http://microsoft.com/ fails.

item.dc:creator: Kitten
item.description: Owner, Resolution changed

item.title: Ticket #192 (Excerpt is summarized when options are set as such.) closed
item.dc:creator: Kitten
item.description: The diff fixes it. Should be rolled in.

item.title: Ticket #192 (Excerpt is summarized when options are set as such.) updated
item.dc:creator: Kitten
item.description: Uploaded wp-rss2.diff as a fix for this, please test and close bug if patch works.

item.title: Ticket #192 (Excerpt is summarized when options are set as such.) created
item.dc:creator: VxJasonxV
item.description:
When a user has their options set to summarize the syndicated content, the excerpt (if given) will be summarized. This should not happen.

An entry should be limited, but in the case an excerpt is entered, the excerpt should be posted in full.

Test: Set your syndication options (Options -> Reading -> Syndication Feeds) to summary, and create a new entry with an excerpt longer than 50 words. View this post with an RSS reader, excerpt has been limited.
